prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in philosophy would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in philosophy would. Evaluate $2911_{11}-1392_{11}$. Express your answer in base 11, using A as the digit representing 10 in base 11.
gpt_response:
To solve the given expression $2911_{11}-1392_{11}$, we can simply subtract the numbers digit by digit while considering regrouping when necessary. 

Starting from the rightmost digit, we have:
$
\begin{array}{c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c}
    & & & {\bf2} & {\bf9} & {\bf1} & {\bf1}_{11} & \\
  - & & & {\bf1} & {\bf3} & {\bf9} & {\bf2}_{11} & \\
\cline{1-7}
  & & & 1_{11} & 9_{11} & 11_{11} & 9_{11} & \\
\end{array}
$

Now, we can convert the result to the correct representation in base 11 by noting that 11 in base 10 is represented as A in base 11. Therefore, the result is $19A9_{11}$.

In conclusion, $2911_{11}-1392_{11} = 19A9_{11}$.
